titlestmt.titleproper: Studley (Vance) collection of Barry Moser prints
Finding Aid for the Vance Studley collection of Barry Moser Prints LSC.0437

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-27 12:23:53 -0700.

did.unittitle: Vance Studley collection of Barry Moser prints
did.abstract: Collection consists of proof prints, wood engravings or resingrave engravings, by Barry Moser. The majority of the prints were designed for the publications Portraits, Literary Genius, Huckleberry Finn, and Men of Printing. Barry Moser (b. 1940) is an award winning artist who has illustrated over 300 books.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Vance Studley collection of Barry Moser prints (Collection Number 437). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Kelley Wolfe Bachli in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), 2009.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Vance Studley is the printer and designer for Barry Moser's Pennyroyal Press. Barry Moser (b. 1940) is an award winning artist who has illustrated over 300 books, including Moby-Dick, Alice's Adventures in Wonderland, and the Caxton Bible. He currently is faculty at the Rhode Island School of Design and Smith College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of proof prints, wood engravings or resingrave engravings, by Barry Moser. The majority of the prints were designed for the publications Portraits, Literary Genius, Huckleberry Finn, and Men of Printing.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Illustrations are sorted by title of publication or genre:
Portraits and Literary Genius
self portraits
Huckleberry Finn
Men of Printing
miscellaneous prints

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proof print for "Jim" from Huckleberry Finn, Pennyroyal Press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proof prints of Eric Gill and T.S. Cobden-Sanderson for the publication Men of Printing, Pennyroyal Press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proof prints for the publication Portraits (2006, Pennyroyal Press) and Literary Genius (2007, Paul Dry Books). Includes prints of Jane Austin, Anton Chekhov, Joseph Conrad, Charles Dickens, Ralph Waldo Emerson, Brunelleschi Filippo, Nathaniel Hawthorne, James Joyce, Flannery O-Connor, Ann Patchett, William Shakespeare, George Bernard Shaw, and Eudora Welty. Portrait of Ann Patchett was designed for the book, but per Patchett's request was not included in the final publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Self portrait for the Robber Bride Groom by Eudora Welty (seated with bucket) and self portrait as a waiter holding up a tray

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proof prints, probably unpublished, of a witch, a wolf, and a cat. The cat was engraved for a bookshop signing in Seattle, Washington.
